programme.title: Other Worlds: Planets
programme.desc: The planets of our solar system are full of mysteries. Meet a few of the scientists who are using the James Webb Space Telescope to look at our solar system and beyond.

programme.title: NASA Presents: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Astronauts disclose their views on space travel, the space station, living in a gravity free environment and on the life altering effects of seeing the Earth from space for the first time.

programme.title: STEMonstrations
programme.desc: STEMonstrations are STEM demonstrations on the space station.

programme.title: Man at the Moon
programme.desc: Man at the Moon.

programme.title: Moon 101
programme.desc: NASA’s documentary series about the Moon.

programme.title: NASA’s Advanced Air Mobility Playbook
programme.desc: NASA’s vision for Advanced Air Mobility, or AAM, is to map out a safe, accessible, and affordable new air transportation system alongside industry partners, community partners and the FAA. NASA is researching what ride quality could be like for passengers traveling in eVTOL aircraft, to make sure it is a smooth and safe ride. In this episode of NASA’s Advanced Air Mobility Playbook, RVLT Project Flight Dynamics and Control Technical Lead Carlos Malpica explains why NASA is uniquely qualified for this research and why it’s important to the future of flight.

programme.title: Ask An Astrobiologist: How & When Do Molecules Become Life with Dr. Henderson ”Jim” Cleaves
programme.desc: Our guest is Dr. Henderson ”Jim” Cleaves! Jim studies the origin of life on Earth and its potential beyond, specifically asking the question: how does chemistry become biology? He is interested in how organic compounds are produced from cosmically-abundant, inorganic compounds, and how these compounds self-organize to form more complex and potentially self-replicating systems. Dr. Cleaves is a member of ISSOL, The International Society for the Study of the Origin of Life, an international astrobiology society; a senior research investigator at Blue Marble Space Institute of Science; and a professor of chemistry at Howard University.

programme.title: NASA Presents: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Astronauts disclose their views on space travel, the space station, living in a gravity free environment and on the life altering effects of seeing the Earth from space for the first time.

programme.title: Artemis I Path to the Pad
programme.desc: Before our Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and Orion spacecraft can launch our nation into a new era of spaceflight, the duo must first undergo a wet dress rehearsal at the launch pad prior to liftoff. Watch SLS and Orion continue on their path to the pad as they travel to Kennedy Space Center’s Launch Pad 39B for a full countdown rehearsal - an operation involving hundreds of engineers stationed all across the nation.

programme.title: Moon 101
programme.desc: NASA’s documentary series about the Moon.

programme.title: Visible Together: An AANHPI Conversation with NASA
programme.desc: NASA’s Jonny Kim and Anita Dey sit down with historian Brian Odom to discuss how NASA is making the Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander community visible to the world, Kim’s experience with the space program growing up, and the impact of cultural stereotypes.

programme.title: ISS Expedition 71 In-Flight Interview with WSYR-TV
programme.desc: Expedition 71 will be the 71st long-duration expedition to the International Space Station. The expedition will begin with the departure of Soyuz MS-24 on 6 April 2024 with cosmonaut Oleg Kononenko continuing his ISS command from Expedition 70. It will end with his departure on Soyuz MS-25 with crewmates from MS-24 and MS-25 on 24 September 2024.
